body:
### Summary

Would it be possible to remove the complier suffix from tcl module name when the packages is installed? For example, would it be possibe to change **cuda/10.1.243-gcc-4.8.5** to **cuda/10.1.243** ,  because in the strict sense cuda is not compliedd by gcc-4.8.5, the complier suffix of the module name will confuse the user.

### Rationale

The develop branch spack was used

### Description

Would it possible to add an optional parameter to specified whether to add complier suffix in the tcl module file ?

### Additional information

_No response_

### General information

- [ ] I have run `spack --version` and reported the version of Spack
- [X] I have searched the issues of this repo and believe this is not a duplicate
title: Would it be possible to remove the complier suffix from some tcl module name such as cuda?
